channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Black Friday deal alert: This fastest mini PC under $500 rivals Apple’s M4 Pro Mac mini for a fraction of the price
item.description: Black Friday savings start now! Minisforum M1-1295 Mini PC is the fastest compact computer under $500.

item.title: Airlines say the shutdown may end—but the turbulence won’t
item.description: With record Thanksgiving travel ahead, carriers warn that canceled flights and delayed crews will ripple through the system for days. If you’re flying later this month, you may need to temper your expectations now: The major U.S. airlines are warning that flight disruptions could persist even after the government shutdown ends.

item.title: In the First ‘Toy Story 5’ Trailer, the Age of Toys Is Over
item.description: Greta Lee joins a cast that includes Tom Hanks and Tim Allen. The film opens June 19.

item.title: I broke up with my iPhone, and it felt like leaving a toxic relationship
item.description: Online safety advocate Lennon Torres realized her phone was making her sacrifice peace for convenience.

item.title: Whisper it - Microsoft uncovers sneaky new attack targeting top LLMs to gain access to encrypted traffic
item.description: Microsoft warns AI chat traffic can leak conversation topics through data patterns, exposing privacy flaws even under full encryption.

item.title: The 50 Best Shows on Hulu, WIRED's Picks (November 2025)
item.description: To Cook a Bear, Murdaugh: Death in the Family, and Solar Opposites are just a few of the shows you should be watching on Hulu this month.

item.title: The 25 best Black Friday TV deals so far - early sales on 4K, QLED and OLED TVs
item.description: I'm rounding up today's 21 best early Black Friday TV deals so far, which include record-low prices on best-rated 4K, QLED, and OLED TVs.

item.title: SoftBank’s Nvidia sale rattles market, raises questions
item.description: Wall Street can’t help but wonder: does Son see something right now that others do not?

item.title: Sam Altman’s Creepy Orb Startup Has Only Scanned 2 Percent of Its Ideal Number of Eyeballs
item.description: Can World scan a billion people's eyeballs?

item.title: iRobot's in trouble and I hope we don't lose Roomba, the original and arguably best robot vacuum
item.description: iRobot's financial struggles arrive just as people are finally writing the Roomba's incredible history.

item.title: Only 9% of developers think AI code can be used without human oversight, BairesDev survey reveals
item.description: Senior software developers are preparing for a major shift in how they work as artificial intelligence becomes central to their workflows, according to BairesDev’s latest Dev Barometer report publishing tomorrow. VentureBeat was given an exclusive early look and the findings below come directly from that report. The quarterly global survey, which polled 501 developers and 19 project managers across 92 software initiatives, finds that nearly two-thirds (65%) of senior developers expect their roles to be redefined by AI in 2026. The data highlights a transformation underway in software developme...

item.title: Say Goodbye to Web Chaos: How Spaceship Brings Seamless Control to Your Online Presence
item.description: Website hosting and domain management done the way it should be.

item.title: Rule34dle is a game that mashes up Wordle and smutty cartoon art
item.description: Rule 34 says that if it exists, you can find adult content about it online. A new game shows you just how much smutty art there is of cartoon characters.

item.title: The Running Man review: Edgar Wright and Glen Powell deliver a wild but weak remake
item.description: Stephen King's novel gets another adaptation it does not deserve with Edgar Wright's "The Running Man" starring Glen Powell. Review.

item.title: Disney is losing over $4 million a day in revenue on the YouTube TV blackout
item.description: Disney’s spat with Google’s YouTube TV over a new content distribution contract is costing the entertainment giant $4.3 million a day in lost revenue, Morgan Stanley estimates. That’s $30 million a week as the blackout of channels including ABC and ESPN stretches into its 12th day, Variety reports, though the analysts expect Disney and Google […]

item.title: Microsoft 365 users targeted by major new phishing operation - here's how to stay safe
item.description: Experts warn the barrier for entry into phishing has lowered even further, raising the stakes for cyber-defenders.

item.title: NASA has a broken giant antenna that could upend its 2026 plans
item.description: NASA's giant Mars Antenna failure hinders spacecraft communication and asteroid studies amid the federal government shutdown.

item.title: OpenAI Will Lose $74 Billion the Same Year That Anthropic Breaks Even: Report
item.description: The money's all made up anyway.

item.title: 15+ Veterans Day 2025 freebies for veterans and active military
item.description: Veterans and active military can score plenty of free meals, coffees, and more on Veterans Day 2025.

item.title: Unitree robot dog with GPT smarts and 4D LiDAR vision gets early Black Friday deal - and it's cheaper than you might think
item.description: Unitree Go2 Air Robot Dog is selling on JoyBuy for £2,399, down from its usual £2,599 asking price.

item.title: ‘The Running Man’ Is a Fun, Fast-Paced Ride With an Unfortunate Stumble
item.description: Glen Powell stars in the new film from Edgar Wright, based on the Stephen King novel.

item.title: ‘The Running Man’ Conjures a Dystopian Vision of America That’s Still Not as Bad as Reality
item.description: Edgar Wright’s violent, incoherent remake is hard to view as satire in a world where right-wing narratives and reality-TV-style ICE raids dominate the media.

item.title: Pixel phones are getting notification summaries
item.description: Google is releasing an update for Pixel phones with an interesting feature in the mix: notification summaries. Apple notably had plenty of trouble implementing its version of this AI-powered feature, and Google is taking a cautious first step by deploying it only for chat conversations. It’ll arrive as part of this month’s Pixel update for […]

item.title: Google is introducing its own version of Apple’s private AI cloud compute
item.description: Google is rolling out a new cloud-based platform that lets users unlock advanced AI features on their devices while keeping data private. The feature, virtually identical to Apple’s Private Cloud Compute, comes as companies reconcile users’ demands for privacy with the growing computational needs of the latest AI applications. Many Google products run AI features […]...

item.title: Google Pixel update adds battery-saving maps mode, AI photo remixing, and smarter notifications
item.description: Google says the new power saving mode for Google Maps can save you up to four hours of battery life

item.title: Target has a new ’10-4′ policy: Here’s what customers can expect from the retailer’s turnaround plans
item.description: Target reportedly has new employee rules to “elevate” the shopping experience heading into Black Friday and the holiday season. You may see more smiles next time you walk into a Target. That’s because the big box retailer is hoping to provide an “elevated” customer experience with it’s new “10-4” policy, requiring staffers out on the floor to smile, wave, and welcome customers within 10 feet—and greet those just 4 feet away, USA Today reported....
